Santa Maria Jail Notary

Mobile Notary at the Northern Branch Jail in Santa Maria

On‑site notarization for inmates at the Santa Barbara County Northern Branch Jail. We travel from Los Angeles to Santa Maria so inmates can sign powers of attorney, court documents, real estate paperwork, and other legal forms without waiting until release.

A 376‑bed facility in Santa Maria housing male and female inmates in medium and high‑security units. Many Santa Barbara County social visits are handled here through the centralized ViaPath system.

Call or Text (213) 933‑2507 Schedule Northern Branch Notary
Facility information

About the Northern Branch Jail (Santa Maria)

The Northern Branch Jail is a 376‑bed facility located at 2301 Black Road, Santa Maria, CA 93455. Operated by the Santa Barbara County Sheriff’s Office, it houses male and female inmates in medium and high‑security housing units and serves as a major hub for county inmate housing and social visiting.

  • Address: 2301 Black Road, Santa Maria, CA 93455
  • Capacity: 376 beds
  • Operated by: Santa Barbara County Sheriff’s Office
  • Inmate population: Male and female inmates, medium and high security
  • Distance from Los Angeles: Approximately 2.5 hours by car

Northern Branch vs. Main Jail

Many social visits for Santa Barbara County inmates are handled at the Northern Branch Jail via the ViaPath scheduling system. This facility is separate from the Santa Barbara County Main Jail on Calle Real in Santa Barbara — the two are about 65 miles apart, so confirming the correct facility before scheduling is essential.

  • Northern Branch Jail: Santa Maria, 376‑bed medium/high‑security facility
  • Main Jail: Calle Real, Santa Barbara (about 65 miles south)
  • Action: Verify which jail the inmate is in using the county inmate locator or by phone
Documents we notarize

Common Documents for Northern Branch Jail Inmates

Powers of attorney & authorizations

  • General power of attorney
  • Limited or special power of attorney
  • Durable power of attorney for finances
  • Healthcare power of attorney / advance directive
  • DMV power of attorney for vehicle transfers
  • Bank and financial institution authorizations

Court, real estate, and other documents

  • Declarations and affidavits for court
  • Family law, custody, and support‑related documents
  • Grant deeds, quitclaim deeds, and escrow documents
  • Lease agreements and rental authorizations
  • Vehicle title transfers and business documents
  • Insurance claims, benefit forms, and other notarized forms
How it works

Scheduling a Notary Appointment at the Northern Branch Jail

1. Contact us with the inmate’s information

Call or text with the inmate’s full legal name, booking or CID number if available, and a description of the documents to be notarized. Let us know your deadline so we can prioritize scheduling.

2. We coordinate with Northern Branch staff

We contact the Northern Branch Jail to confirm housing location, current visiting procedures, and how professional visits are handled. We work within the ViaPath scheduling framework and coordinate with the watch commander or designated staff to arrange the notary visit.

3. Prepare your documents

Have all documents complete and ready before the appointment. We cannot draft legal documents or provide legal advice — our role is to verify identity, witness signatures, and complete the notarization. If the inmate needs to review documents ahead of time, coordinate with their attorney or use the jail’s mail or email systems.

4. The notary appointment in Santa Maria

We travel from Los Angeles to Santa Maria, check in with custody staff, and are escorted to the designated visiting area. The inmate confirms their identity, signs the documents in our presence, and we complete the notarial certificate according to California law.

5. Document delivery

After the visit, we return the originals to you, your attorney, a title or escrow company, or any other designated recipient. Depending on your deadlines, we can hand‑deliver locally, overnight by courier, or return by mail.

Call or Text (213) 933‑2507 Schedule Appointment

Tip: The Northern Branch Jail is approximately 2.5 hours from Los Angeles and is our farthest regularly served facility. Please provide as much lead time as possible, but we do our best to accommodate urgent, court‑driven requests.

Pricing

Northern Branch Jail Notary Fees (Santa Maria)

Jail notarizations at the Northern Branch Jail require extended travel from Los Angeles to Santa Maria, coordination with custody staff and ViaPath scheduling, security screening, and escort to the visiting area. Pricing reflects the significant distance and additional time required.

  • Northern Branch appointments: Among our highest travel‑based fees due to distance
  • Price includes travel to Santa Maria, coordination, check‑in, escort, and notarization
  • Additional signatures at the same appointment may be added for a reduced fee
  • Rush or date‑specific appointments may have additional fees based on availability

What is included

  • Travel from Los Angeles to the Northern Branch Jail and back
  • Coordination with custody staff and ViaPath scheduling
  • Security screening, check‑in, and escort to and from the visiting area
  • Notarization of documents (California notary fees per signature)
  • Return of documents to you or your designated recipient

Final pricing depends on the number of documents, any special circumstances, and timing. Call or text for a quote based on your specific situation.

Common Questions

Northern Branch Jail Notary FAQs (Santa Maria)

Where is the Northern Branch Jail located?

The Northern Branch Jail is located at 2301 Black Road, Santa Maria, CA 93455. It is a 376‑bed Santa Barbara County facility that houses male and female inmates in medium and high‑security housing units.

Can a mobile notary visit the Northern Branch Jail?

Yes. Independent mobile notaries can provide services at the Northern Branch Jail. The notary coordinates with the watch commander, checks in with custody staff, and completes the notarization during a professional visit.

What are the visiting hours and scheduling rules?

The Northern Branch Jail offers visits Sunday through Saturday, 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. Visits are scheduled through the ViaPath online registration system, appointments start on the hour, and visitors should check in 15 to 30 minutes before their scheduled time.

How many visits are inmates allowed at Northern Branch?

Inmates at the Northern Branch Jail are generally allowed up to four visits per week. All visitors must be on the inmate’s approved visitor list and must check in with the same photo ID used to register online.

Is the Northern Branch Jail the same as the Main Jail?

No. The Northern Branch Jail in Santa Maria and the Main Jail on Calle Real in Santa Barbara are separate facilities about 65 miles apart. Both are operated by the Santa Barbara County Sheriff’s Office, and many social visits for county inmates are handled at the Northern Branch.

How long should I plan for a Northern Branch notary appointment?

Plan for 5 to 7 hours total, including travel from Los Angeles to Santa Maria (approximately 2.5 hours each way), check‑in with custody staff, wait time, and the signing itself. The notarization portion is quick, but the distance adds significant travel time.

How do I confirm someone is at the Northern Branch Jail?

You can search the Santa Barbara County Sheriff’s Office inmate locator online or call the Northern Branch Jail at (805) 554‑3100 with the inmate’s name and date of birth.

Other jails we serve

Need notary services at a different facility?

We provide mobile notary services at jails and detention centers throughout Santa Barbara County, Ventura County, Los Angeles County, and Southern California.

Santa Barbara County

  • Santa Barbara County Main Jail (Calle Real)

Other Counties

  • Ventura County jails (selected facilities)
  • Los Angeles County jails (Men’s Central, Twin Towers, etc.)

Not sure which jail? Call or text with the inmate’s name and we can help locate them and coordinate the appointment. For an overview of all jail notary services, visit our Jail Notary hub page.
